summary: Responding to two 1998 terrorist bombings of U.S. embassies, the State Department embarked on a program to construct more secure embassies. While it had completed 77 as of September 2017, State won't reach its goal of 180 new embassies by 2018. Unexpected requirements—such as adding office annexes—and not accounting for inflation have contributed to slowing project delivery. With over 20 embassies under construction and 72...
title: Embassy Construction: Pace Is Slower Than Projected, and State Could Make Program Improvements
